etymology.description: pictogram: body and legs of an insect.
etymology.interpretation: A direct sketch of an insect, with a rounded body above and splayed legs below. This image motivates senses tied to insects and, by extension in classical usage, to numerous kin and descendants.

examples.chinese: 我对昆虫很感兴趣(我對昆蟲很感興趣)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ duì kūnchóng hěn gǎn xìngqù.

examples.chinese: 昆明是云南省的省会(昆明是雲南省的省會)。
examples.pinyin: Kūnmíng shì Yúnnán shěng de shěnghuì.
examples.english: Kunming is the capital of Yunnan Province.

examples.chinese: 他是先王的昆裔(他是先王的昆裔)。
examples.english: He is a descendant of the former king.
